articles.title: Vernon's Shanda Hill overcoming huge challenges during toughest race in the world
articles.description:
It has been a challenging few days for Vernon's Shanda Hill to say the least.

The ultra athlete is currently taking on the biggest test of her life: the Triple Deca Ultra Triathlon in Italy.
articles.content:
Vernon

articles.title: The best Paralympic images by Tom Jenkins - a photo essay
articles.description: Our photographer spent the past fortnight in Paris documenting everything from blind football to para-triathlon. Here are some of his favourite pics from the Games
articles.content: When I went to Paris for the Paralympic Games, I was slightly fearful for them. After all, how do you follow such a successful Olympics? Could the city rouse itself for another mega show just a fortnight later? I needn’t have worried – these Games we... [4464 chars]

articles.title: Memoir: A police officer on how he competed in the Ironman triathlon despite suffering from cancer
articles.description: An excerpt from the Preface to ‘Cancerman to Ironman: A Police Officer’s Journey of Arresting Illness’, by Nidhin Valsan.
articles.content: The most difficult ordeal a person endures is pain without explanation. Pain, physical or mental, is bearable if one understands the underlying cause. It becomes less intense. Sometimes, it’s even pleasurable. You might blame yourself or the bad thin... [7299 chars]

articles.title: Cycling silver as Lauren Parker smashes 44-year record
articles.description: Lauren Parker is Australia's first dual-sport Paralympic medallist adding a cycling silver to her triathlon gold.
articles.content:
Lauren Parker is basking in the glory of becoming Australia’s first dual-sport Paralympic medallist in 44 years after claiming silver in the women’s H1-3 individual time trial to add to her triathlon gold.
After finishing first in the para-triathlon ... [2216 chars]

articles.title: Aussie Paralympian Lauren Parker on the brink of freakish 40-year first after PTWC triathlon gold
articles.description: The 35-year-old has already exacted revenge on a rival to win gold, but she’s not finished.
articles.content:
Lauren Parker’s bid to become Australia’s first dual-sport Paralympic medallist in more than 40 years is alive after she buried the pain of Tokyo to win the gold medal in the PTWC triathlon.
The 35-year-old, who missed out on gold in Japan by just on... [2661 chars]

articles.title: Paralympics 2024: Australian first in boccia amid triathlon glory as Steelers net gritty bronze
articles.description: A look at the highlights of day five of the 2024 Paris Paralympics, where Australia's boccia team picked up two singles medals.
articles.content:
GOLD
Lauren Parker, (triathlon, women’s PTWC) - Parker’s redemption story is complete. She has been tortured by her one-second loss to Kendall Gretsch in Tokyo and exacted revenge on the American in style.

articles.title: Triathlon sisters Chloe & Judith MacCombe overcome illness and injury to finish 6th and 8th in Paris
articles.description: TWIN sisters Chloe and Judith MacCombe gave it two to the power of three in the PTVI Para Triathlon yesterday, finishing sixth and eighth respectively
articles.content:
TWIN sisters Chloe and Judith MacCombe gave it two to the power of three in the PTVI Para Triathlon yesterday, finishing sixth and eighth respectively.

articles.title: ‘We are always proud of each other’: Ireland’s MacCombe sisters celebrate strong showing in Paralympic triathlon
articles.description: Twins Chloe and Judith MacCombe finish sixth and eighth respectively in PTVI para triathlon
